result: C) a continuous spectrum. The girl's skin cells were not able to produce melanin because the light emitted by the incandescent lamp is a continuous spectrum, which means that it contains all the colors of the visible spectrum and does not have any specific wavelength that can stimulate the production of melanin. To achieve a bronzely effect, the light must contain a specific wavelength that can stimulate the production of melanin, such as ultraviolet light or infrared light.
